info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 5:11AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Reduced Visibility through Thursday Morning... Low clouds and areas of fog are present across portions of the Hi-Line this morning. These low clouds and fog are expected to persist through Thursday morning before slowly dissipating in the afternoon hours. While most locations will see reductions in visibility to as low as one to three miles in areas of fog, locally dense fog with visibilities as low as one quarter mile are possible in prone areas within the Milk River Valley and along the eastern slopes of the Bears Paw Mountains. Travlers should be prepared for changing conditions over short distances. Slick roads are possible, especially on elevated surfaces such as bridges and overpasses. Slow down, make sure your headlights are on, and allow extra time to get to your destination.
